member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264
member.summary: Represents the picture level control elements for the associated command for H.264 encoding.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.Flags
member.summary: A bitwise OR combination of values from the enumeration specifying configuration flags for the frame being encoded.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.FrameType
member.summary: A value from the enumeration specifying the picture type. Make sure that the codec-specific flags support the specified type. This selection must be kept in sync with the GOP structure configuration set by the host. Note that the GOP is defined in display order and this pic type selection must follow the GOP, but in encode order.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.pic_parameter_set_id
member.summary: A UINT specifying the value to be used in the slice headers of the current frame to reference the PPS.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.idr_pic_id
member.summary: When FrameType** is D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_FRAME_TYPE_H264_IDR_FRAME, a UINT indicating the identifier of the IDR frame to be used in all the slices headers present in the frame.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.PictureOrderCountNumber
member.summary: A UINT specifying the current frame display order.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.FrameDecodingOrderNumber
member.summary: A UINT specifying the frame decode order with semantic as indicated by the slice header frame_num syntax element that increments after each reference picture.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.TemporalLayerIndex
member.summary: A UINT specifying the picture layer number in temporal hierarchy. Check for the maximum number of layers in .

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.List0ReferenceFramesCount
member.summary: A UINT specifying the number of past frame references to be used for this frame. This value should be coherent with what was exposed in D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_CODEC_CONFIGURATION_SUPPORT_H264.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.pList0ReferenceFrames
member.summary: A pointer to a UINT array specifying the list of past frame reference frames to be used for this frame. Each integer value in this array indices into pReferenceFramesReconPictureDescriptors to reference pictures kept in the DPB.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.List1ReferenceFramesCount
member.summary: A UINT specifying the number of future frame references to be used for this frame. This value should be coherent with what was exposed in D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_CODEC_CONFIGURATION_SUPPORT_H264.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.pList1ReferenceFrames
member.summary: A pointer to a UINT array specifying the list of future frame reference frames to be used for this frame. Each integer value in this array indices into pReferenceFramesReconPictureDescriptors to reference pictures kept in the DPB.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.ReferenceFramesReconPictureDescriptorsCount
member.summary: A UINT specifying the number of entries in pReferenceFramesReconPictureDescriptors.

summary.para: A pointer to a UINT array that describes the current state of the DPB buffer kept in . The pList0ReferenceFrames and pList1ReferenceFrames lists indices map from past/future references into this descriptors array.

This array of descriptors, in turn, maps a reference picture for this frame into a resource index in the reconstructed pictures array D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_DESC.ReferenceFrames. Additionally, for each reference picture it indicates the encode and display order number and whether it is a long term reference.
The size of this array always matches D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_DESC.ReferenceFrames.NumTextures for the associated EncodeFrame command.
A UCHAR defining a semantic mode for the frame reference handling.

| adaptive_ref_pic_marking_mode_flag value | Reference picture marking mode specified | |-------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------| | 0 | 1 | | Sliding window reference picture marking mode: A marking mode providing a first-in first-out mechanism for short-term reference pictures. | Adaptive reference picture marking mode: A reference picture marking mode providing syntax elements to specify marking of reference pictures as "unused for reference" and to assign long-term frame indices. |

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.RefPicMarkingOperationsCommandsCount
member.summary: A UINT specifying the number of reference pictures marking operations associated with the current frame. Requires that adaptive_ref_pic_marking_mode_flag is set to 1.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.pRefPicMarkingOperationsCommands
member.summary: A pointer to an array of structures representing the list of reference pictures marking operations associated with the current frame. The operations described by this list need to be reflected in the DPB descriptors accordingly during the encoding session.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.List0RefPicModificationsCount
member.summary: A UINT specifying the number of items in pList0RefPicModifications.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.pList0RefPicModifications
member.summary: A pointer to an array of structures representing the list of reference picture list modification operations for the pList0ReferenceFrames list.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.List1RefPicModificationsCount
member.summary: A UINT specifying the number of items in pList1RefPicModifications.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.pList1RefPicModifications
member.summary: A pointer to an array of structures representing the list of reference picture list modification operations for the pList1ReferenceFrames list.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.QPMapValuesCount
member.summary: A UINT specifying the number of elements present in pRateControlQPMap. This should match the number of coding blocks in the frame, rounding up the frame resolution to the closest aligned values.

member.name: D3D12_VIDEO_ENCODER_PICTURE_CONTROL_CODEC_DATA_H264.pRateControlQPMap
member.summary: A pointer to an array of Int8 containing, in row/column scan order, the QP map values to use on each squared region for this frame. The QP map dimensions can be calculated using the current resolution and conveying the squared region sizes.
